intro: Oxydectes leptophylla, commonly known as the slender-leaved oxydectes, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are narrow and linear, and the flowers are small, yellowish, and arranged in a flat-topped cluster. Oxydectes leptophylla is often found in coastal and mountainous regions, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
